executable.title: Easy Registration (BRAINS)
executable.description: Register a three-dimensional volume to a reference volume (Mattes Mutual Information by default). Full documentation avalable here: http://wiki.slicer.org/slicerWiki/index.php/Documentation/4.1/Modules/BRAINSFit. Method described in BRAINSFit: Mutual Information Registrations of Whole-Brain 3D Images, Using the Insight Toolkit, Johnson H.J., Harris G., Williams K., The Insight Journal, 2007. http://hdl.handle.net/1926/1291
executable.contributor: Hans J. Johnson, hans-johnson -at- uiowa.edu, http://www.psychiatry.uiowa.edu
executable.acknowledgements: Hans Johnson(1,3,4); Kent Williams(1); Gregory Harris(1), Vincent Magnotta(1,2,3); Andriy Fedorov(5) 1=University of Iowa Department of Psychiatry, 2=University of Iowa Department of Radiology, 3=University of Iowa Department of Biomedical Engineering, 4=University of Iowa Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, 5=Surgical Planning Lab, Harvard

image.name: fixedVolume
image.label: Fixed Image Volume
image.description: The fixed image for registration by mutual information optimization.

image.name: movingVolume
image.label: Moving Image Volume
image.description: The moving image for registration by mutual information optimization.

parameters.label: Output Settings (At least one output must be specified.)

transform.name: linearTransform
transform.label: Slicer Resulting Transform
transform.description: (optional) Filename to which save the estimated transform. NOTE: You must set at least one output object (either a deformed image or a transform. NOTE: USE THIS ONLY IF THE FINAL TRANSFORM IS ---NOT--- BSpline

parameters.label: Simple Registration Phases (Check one or more, executed in order listed)
parameters.description: Each of the registration phases will be used to initialize the next phase

boolean.name: useRigid
boolean.label: Rigid (6 DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a rigid registration as part of the sequential registration steps. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

boolean.name: useAffine
boolean.label: Affine(12 DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a series of registrations to that culminates with an Affine transform being defined. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

parameters.label: Transform Initialization (Optional)
parameters.description: Options to define how registrations should be initialized

string-enumeration.name: initializeTransformMode
string-enumeration.label: Intitialze Transform Mode
string-enumeration.description: Determine how to initialize the transform center. GeometryAlign on assumes that the center of the voxel lattice of the images represent similar structures. MomentsAlign assumes that the center of mass of the images represent similar structures. useCenterOfHeadAlign attempts to use the top of head and shape of neck to drive a center of mass estimate. Off assumes that the physical space of the images are close, and that centering in terms of the image Origins is a good starting point. This flag is mutually exclusive with the initialTransform flag.

transform.name: initialTransform
transform.label: Initialization transform
transform.description: Filename of transform used to initialize the registration. This CAN NOT be used with either CenterOfHeadLAlign, MomentsAlign, GeometryAlign, or initialTransform file.

parameters.label: Advanced Hidden Parameters
parameters.description: Use the advanced version of BRAINSFit for more flexibility

transform.name: bsplineTransform
transform.label: Slicer BSpline Transform
transform.description: (optional) Filename to which save the estimated transform. NOTE: You must set at least one output object (either a deformed image or a transform. NOTE: USE THIS ONLY IF THE FINAL TRANSFORM IS BSpline (Advanced)

image.name: outputVolume
image.label: Output Image Volume
image.description: (optional) Output image for registration. NOTE: You must select either the outputTransform or the outputVolume option.

boolean.name: useScaleVersor3D
boolean.label: Rigid+Scale(7 DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a ScaleVersor3D registration as part of the sequential registration steps. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

boolean.name: useScaleSkewVersor3D
boolean.label: Rigid+Scale+Skew(10 DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a ScaleSkewVersor3D registration as part of the sequential registration steps. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

boolean.name: useBSpline
boolean.label: BSpline (>27 DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a BSpline registration as part of the sequential registration steps. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

boolean.name: useComposite
boolean.label: Composite (many DOF)
boolean.description: Perform a Composite registration as part of the sequential registration steps. This family of options superceeds the use of transformType if any of them are set.

integer.name: numberOfSamples
integer.label: Number Of Samples
integer.description: The number of voxels sampled for mutual information computation. Increase this for a slower, more careful fit. You can also limit the sampling focus with ROI masks and ROIAUTO mask generation.

integer-vector.name: splineGridSize
integer-vector.label: B-Spline Grid Size
integer-vector.description: The number of subdivisions of the BSpline Grid to be centered on the image space. Each dimension must have at least 3 subdivisions for the BSpline to be correctly computed.

integer-vector.name: numberOfIterations
integer-vector.label: Max Iterations
integer-vector.description: The maximum number of iterations to try before failing to converge. Use an explicit limit like 500 or 1000 to manage risk of divergence

string-enumeration.name: maskProcessingMode
string-enumeration.description: What mode to use for using the masks. If ROIAUTO is choosen, then the mask is implicitly defined using a otsu forground and hole filling algorithm. The Region Of Interest mode (choose ROI) uses the masks to define what parts of the image should be used for computing the transform.
string-enumeration.label: Masking Option

image.name: fixedBinaryVolume
image.label: (ROI)Masking input fixed
image.description: Fixed Image binary mask volume, ONLY FOR MANUAL ROI mode.

image.name: movingBinaryVolume
image.label: (ROI)Masking input moving
image.description: Moving Image binary mask volume, ONLY FOR MANUAL ROI mode.

image.name: outputFixedVolumeROI
image.label: (ROIAUTO) Output fixed mask
image.description: The ROI automatically found in fixed image, ONLY FOR ROIAUTO mode.

image.name: outputMovingVolumeROI
image.label: (ROIAUTO) Output moving mask
image.description: The ROI automatically found in moving image, ONLY FOR ROIAUTO mode.

string-enumeration.name: outputVolumePixelType
string-enumeration.label: Output Image Pixel Type
string-enumeration.description: The output image Pixel Type is the scalar datatype for representation of the Output Volume.

double.name: backgroundFillValue
double.label: Background Fill Value
double.description: Background fill value for output image.

double.name: maskInferiorCutOffFromCenter
double.label: Inferior Cut Off From Center
double.description: For use with --initializeTransformMode useCenterOfHeadAlign (and --maskProcessingMode ROIAUTO): the cut-off below the image centers, in millimeters,

boolean.name: scaleOutputValues
boolean.label: Scale Output Values
boolean.description: If true, and the voxel values do not fit within the minimum and maximum values of the desired outputVolumePixelType, then linearly scale the min/max output image voxel values to fit within the min/max range of the outputVolumePixelType.

string-enumeration.name: interpolationMode
string-enumeration.label: Interpolation Mode
string-enumeration.description: Type of interpolation to be used when applying transform to moving volume. Options are Linear, NearestNeighbor, BSpline, WindowedSinc, or ResampleInPlace. The ResampleInPlace option will create an image with the same discrete voxel values and will adjust the origin and direction of the physical space interpretation.

double-vector.name: minimumStepLength
double-vector.label: Minimum Step Length
double-vector.description: Each step in the optimization takes steps at least this big. When none are possible, registration is complete.

double.name: translationScale
double.label: Transform Scale
double.description: How much to scale up changes in position compared to unit rotational changes in radians -- decrease this to put more rotation in the search pattern.

double.name: reproportionScale
double.label: Reproportion Scale
double.description: ScaleVersor3D 'Scale' compensation factor. Increase this to put more rescaling in a ScaleVersor3D or ScaleSkewVersor3D search pattern. 1.0 works well with a translationScale of 1000.0

double.name: skewScale
double.label: Skew Scale
double.description: ScaleSkewVersor3D Skew compensation factor. Increase this to put more skew in a ScaleSkewVersor3D search pattern. 1.0 works well with a translationScale of 1000.0

double.name: maxBSplineDisplacement
double.label: Maximum B-Spline Displacement
double.description: Sets the maximum allowed displacements in image physical coordinates for BSpline control grid along each axis. A value of 0.0 indicates that the problem should be unbounded. NOTE: This only constrains the BSpline portion, and does not limit the displacement from the associated bulk transform. This can lead to a substantial reduction in computation time in the BSpline optimizer.

boolean.name: histogramMatch
boolean.description: Histogram Match the input images. This is suitable for images of the same modality that may have different absolute scales, but the same overall intensity profile. Do NOT use if registering images from different modailties.
boolean.label: Histogram Match

transform.name: strippedOutputTransform
transform.label: Stripped Output Transform
transform.description: File name for the rigid component of the estimated affine transform. Can be used to rigidly register the moving image to the fixed image. NOTE: This value is overwritten if either bsplineTransform or linearTransform is set.

string-vector.name: transformType
string-vector.label: Transform Type
string-vector.description: Specifies a list of registration types to be used. The valid types are, Rigid, ScaleVersor3D, ScaleSkewVersor3D, Affine, and BSpline. Specifiying more than one in a comma separated list will initialize the next stage with the previous results. If registrationClass flag is used, it overrides this parameter setting.

transform.name: outputTransform
transform.label: Output Transform
transform.description: (optional) Filename to which save the (optional) estimated transform. NOTE: You must select either the outputTransform or the outputVolume option.

integer.name: fixedVolumeTimeIndex
integer.label: Fixed Image Time Index
integer.description: The index in the time series for the 3D fixed image to fit, if 4-dimensional.

integer.name: movingVolumeTimeIndex
integer.label: Moving Image Time Index
integer.description: The index in the time series for the 3D moving image to fit, if 4-dimensional.

integer-vector.name: medianFilterSize
integer-vector.label: Median Filter Size
integer-vector.description: The radius for the optional MedianImageFilter preprocessing in all 3 directions.

double.name: removeIntensityOutliers
double.label: Remove Intensity Outliers value at one tail
double.description: The half percentage to decide outliers of image intensities. The default value is zero, which means no outlier removal. If the value of 0.005 is given, the moduel will throw away 0.005 % of both tails, so 0.01% of intensities in total would be ignored in its statistic calculation.

string-enumeration.name: useCachingOfBSplineWeightsMode
string-enumeration.description: This is a 5x speed advantage at the expense of requiring much more memory. Only relevant when transformType is BSpline.
string-enumeration.label: Caching BSpline Weights Mode

string-enumeration.name: useExplicitPDFDerivativesMode
string-enumeration.description: Using mode AUTO means OFF for BSplineDeformableTransforms and ON for the linear transforms. The ON alternative uses more memory to sometimes do a better job.
string-enumeration.label: Explicit PDF Derivatives Mode

double.name: ROIAutoDilateSize
double.label: ROIAuto Dilate Size
double.description: This flag is only relavent when using ROIAUTO mode for initializing masks. It defines the final dilation size to capture a bit of background outside the tissue region. At setting of 10mm has been shown to help regularize a BSpline registration type so that there is some background constraints to match the edges of the head better.

double.name: ROIAutoClosingSize
double.label: ROIAuto Closing Size
double.description: This flag is only relavent when using ROIAUTO mode for initializing masks. It defines the hole closing size in mm. It is rounded up to the nearest whole pixel size in each direction. The default is to use a closing size of 9mm. For mouse data this value may need to be reset to 0.9 or smaller.

double.name: relaxationFactor
double.label: Relaxation Factor
double.description: Internal debugging parameter, and should probably never be used from the command line. This will be removed in the future.

double.name: maximumStepLength
double.label: Maximum Step Length
double.description: Internal debugging parameter, and should probably never be used from the command line. This will be removed in the future.

integer.name: failureExitCode
integer.label: Failure Exit Code
integer.description: If the fit fails, exit with this status code. (It can be used to force a successfult exit status of (0) if the registration fails due to reaching the maximum number of iterations.

boolean.name: writeTransformOnFailure
boolean.label: Write Transform On Failure
boolean.description: Flag to save the final transform even if the numberOfIterations are reached without convergence. (Intended for use when --failureExitCode 0 )

integer.name: numberOfThreads
integer.label: Number Of Threads
integer.description: Explicitly specify the maximum number of threads to use. (default is auto-detected)

integer.name: forceMINumberOfThreads
integer.label: Debug MI metric Number Of Threads
integer.description: Force the the maximum number of threads to use for non thread safe MI metric.

integer.name: debugLevel
integer.label: Debug option
integer.description: Display debug messages, and produce debug intermediate results. 0=OFF, 1=Minimal, 10=Maximum debugging.

double.name: costFunctionConvergenceFactor
double.description: From itkLBFGSBOptimizer.h: Set/Get the CostFunctionConvergenceFactor. Algorithm terminates when the reduction in cost function is less than (factor * epsmcj) where epsmch is the machine precision. Typical values for factor: 1e+12 for low accuracy; 1e+7 for moderate accuracy and 1e+1 for extremely high accuracy. 1e+9 seems to work well.

double.name: projectedGradientTolerance
double.description: From itkLBFGSBOptimizer.h: Set/Get the ProjectedGradientTolerance. Algorithm terminates when the project gradient is below the tolerance. Default lbfgsb value is 1e-5, but 1e-4 seems to work well.

boolean.name: UseDebugImageViewer
boolean.description: Display intermediate image volumes for debugging. NOTE: This is not part of the standard build sytem, and probably does nothing on your installation.

boolean.name: PromptAfterImageSend
boolean.description: Prompt the user to hit enter each time an image is sent to the DebugImageViewer

integer-vector.name: permitParameterVariation
integer-vector.label: Selective Permission for Transform Parameters to Vary
integer-vector.description: A bit vector to permit linear transform parameters to vary under optimization. The vector order corresponds with transform parameters, and beyond the end ones fill in as a default. For instance, you can choose to rotate only in x (pitch) with 1,0,0; this is mostly for expert use in turning on and off individual degrees of freedom in rotation, translation or scaling without multiplying the number of transform representations; this trick is probably meaningless when tried with the general affine transform.

string-enumeration.name: costMetric
string-enumeration.label: Cost Metric
string-enumeration.description: The cost metric to be used during fitting. Defaults to MMI. Options are MMI (Mattes Mutual Information), MSE (Mean Square Error), NC (Normalized Correlation), MC (Match Cardinality for binary images)
